document_title: Blood in the urine (hematuria): Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Hematuria is mainly diagnosed based on urine test results. Based on the number of red blood cells in the urine, the doctor will consider the patient's urinary health status. In addition, hematuria is also diagnosed by other methods such as:
Urine test: Tests the concentration of substances in urine; Urine culture: Check for infection and bacteria in the patient's urine sample; Urine cytology test: Test finds abnormal cells in urine
Combining the urine test results with the patient's clinical signs, the doctor will direct the patient to continue doing more in-depth tests. This operation is to find the cause of this symptom of hematuria and treat it.
These diagnostic methods include:
Cystoscopy; Ultrasound of kidneys, urinary tract, bladder; CT scan; MRI scan
